definition: lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
to finish/to be over/whole/complete/entire
skin

sentences.english: Critics have come out on all sides of Bernanke's highly accommodative monetary policy.
sentences.chinese: 伯南克高度寬鬆的貨幣政策已然被批評地體無完膚。

sentences.english: This sarcasm knocked the speaker's argument info a cocked hat.
sentences.chinese: 這種諷刺話把講話人的論點駁得體無完膚。

sentences.english: Rely on can make people happy but it can also make you hurt injured all over the body.
sentences.chinese: 依賴可以讓人幸福但它也可以把你傷的體無完膚。

sentences.english: The president's new policy was taken to pieces by the opposite.
sentences.chinese: 反對派把總統的新政策批得體無完膚。

sentences.english: Thank you for hurting me let me see the Qingxudong injured all over the body, false love.
sentences.chinese: 謝謝你傷到我體無完膚，讓我看清虛假的愛情。

sentences.english: This fallacy has long since been torn to shreds.
sentences.chinese: 這種謬論早已被批得體無完膚。

sentences.english: Towards evening, pig be a nass of bruises is brought back piggery.
sentences.chinese: 傍晚，豬體無完膚被帶回豬圈。

sentences.english: His latest novel was cut up by the reviewers.
sentences.chinese: 他的最新小說被評論家批得體無完膚。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister made mincemeat of his opponent's arguments.
sentences.chinese: 首相把對方反對他的論點駁得體無完膚。
勞拉倖存下來了，但卻體無完膚。

sentences.english: We get devastated and start reminiscing the past happy time.
sentences.chinese: 我們被打擊的體無完膚然後開始回想過去的美好。

definition: covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
bruised/riddled with scars
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
hard to deal with/hard to get along with
at one's wit's end/unable to find a way out
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to go round and round/running around in circles/fig. frantically busy
effeminate/old-womanish/garrulous/fainthearted/overly careful/overly sensitive/maudlin
to keep one's calm in the face of the unexpected/not to wonder at strange sights
sloppy
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
